title: ‘American Buffalo’ Review: To Coin an Angry Phrase
sub_head: David Mamet’s play about a trio of outraged ne’er-do-wells plotting to steal a valuable nickel returns to Broadway and features Laurence Fishburne
body:
New York
Now might seem an inopportune time to be reviving a play by David Mamet, who could be called America’s bard of toxic masculinity, although the term was hardly current—in fact it hadn’t entered the popular lexicon, let alone swamped it—when Mr. Mamet was in his prime.
